header.title: Upcoming Potential Incompatibilities

section.title: Introduction
section.p: This document lists planned upcoming potential incompatibilities in Erlang/OTP.

section.title: Fun creator pid will always be local init process
section.p:
As of OTP 27, the functions
erlang:fun_info/1,2 will always say that the local init process created all funs, regardless of which process or node the fun was originally created on.
In OTP 28, the {pid,_}element will be removed altogether.

section.title: Feature maybe_expr will be enabled by default
section.p: As of OTP 27, the maybe_expr feature will be approved and enabled by default. That means that code that uses the unquoted atom maybe will fail to compile. All uses of maybe as an atom will need to be quoted. Alternatively, as a short-term solution, the maybe_expr feature can be disabled.
It is recommend to quote all uses of the atom maybe as soon as possible. The compiler option warn_keywords can be used to emit warnings about all occurrences of maybe without quotes.

section.title: Fun creator pid will be removed
section.p: As of OTP 28, the function erlang:fun_info/1 will not include the {pid,_} element and the function erlang:fun_info/2 will no longer accept pid as the second argument.

section.title: It will no longer be possible to disable feature maybe_expr
section.p: As of OTP 29, the maybe_expr feature will become permanent and no longer possible to disable. All uses of maybe as an atom will need to be quoted.
It is recommend to quote all uses of the atom maybe as soon as possible. The compiler option warn_keywords can be used to emit warnings about all occurrences of maybe without quotes.
